properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR out 10 nm
properties.headline: Hazardous Seas Warning issued January 8 at 3:32AM PST until January 9 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Small Craft Advisory, southwest winds 15 to 25 kt
with gusts up to 30 kt and seas 8 to 12 feet at 12 seconds. For
the Hazardous Seas Warning, very steep and hazardous seas 12 to
14 feet at 10 seconds expected. For the Hazardous Seas Watch,
very steep and hazardous seas 20 to 25 feet at 16 seconds
possible.

* WHERE...All of the area.

* WHEN...For the Small Craft Advisory, until 4 AM PST Thursday. For
the Hazardous Seas Warning, from 4 AM to 10 AM PST Thursday.
For the Hazardous Seas Watch, from late Friday night through
Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...During the advisory period, small boats and
inexperienced mariners could encounter conditions that could
jeopardize safety. During the warning and watch periods, strong
winds and very steep seas could damage or displace fishing gear.
Very steep and hazardous seas could capsize or damage vessels.
Bar crossing will become especially treacherous.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid strong winds and very steep
seas. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe conditions.

A Small Craft Advisory means that winds and seas will create a
potential hazard to smaller vessels and inexperienced mariners.

A Hazardous Seas Warning means very steep and hazardous sea
conditions are imminent or occurring. Recreational boaters should
remain in port, or take shelter until waves subside.  Commercial
vessels should prepare for rough seas and consider remaining in
port or taking shelter in port until hazardous seas subside.

A Hazardous Seas Watch is issued when the risk of very steep and
hazardous seas has significantly increased, but the specific
timing and/or location is still uncertain. It is intended to
provide additional lead time for mariners who may wish to
consider altering their plans.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST THURSDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
